meanings.definition: Inclined or disposed to avoid strife or dissension; not contentious or quarrelsome.
meanings.sent1: The children showed their peaceableness by sharing toys without arguing.
meanings.sent2: The peaceful garden reflected the peaceableness of its caretaker.
meanings.sent3: The peaceableness of the sleepy cat was evident as it purred contentedly in the sun.
meanings.sent4: Her smile radiated a sense of peaceableness that calmed those around her.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the essence of peaceableness in the serene landscape painting.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being peaceful or calm.
meanings.sent1: The peaceableness of the lake at dawn was truly breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: The village thrived on the peaceableness of its community members.
meanings.sent3: The peaceableness of the library was disrupted by a loud sneeze.
meanings.sent4: In the chaos of the city, she longed for the peaceableness of the countryside.
meanings.sent5: The old tree exuded a sense of peaceableness that soothed all who passed by.
